efff4d36-0698-46ae-b840-eb6430ae8693: A creature targeted by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is held immobile by glowing golden chains composed of pure sunlight. For a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, the creature is paralyzed, held in place, and is dealt {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus 1 damage per caster level every round. It may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each round to end the effect. If the initial saving throw is successful, the target is staggered for one round and is dealt the same amount of damage.
d882fb83-d529-4a36-893b-d8a84829b675: A frightened creature takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. A frightened creature may start to flee from its enemies.
a95e1512-0760-4c96-ae5f-5f94712d9bae: A key to the portal has been found. But is one enough?
82294d8d-cb1b-47b1-a226-27438a7670b2: A long life in a closed community breeds new eccentricities in its members or intensifies existing quirks to facilitate the psyche's acclimatization. The stargazer Regnard claims that studying the history of Sarkoris is his escape. However, this does not explain the mental crisis the herald of Iomedae sensed in him. Why does Regnard's eccentricity fail to fulfill its function?
0a64264f-3220-4b23-88a6-7133801fed36: A shaken character takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened.
eaf9c96a-3faa-429f-9ca7-2ed3833cade1: A unit of strangers — maybe demon worshipers — is approaching the secret shrine. Katair and the Commander must stop the threat together.
6debf178-4b6e-4e98-821c-b61d603a0b9c: Additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} from Sword of Heaven are now maximized.
eb248c1d-97f4-48b2-a488-74a5577077b0: All allies in a 20-foot radius gain immunity to diseases for 10 minutes.
3ec83115-006e-4551-82d8-d5a445032a68: All allies in a 20-foot radius gain immunity to fatigue, exhaustion, nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases, poisons, {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and ability drain for 10 minutes.
feab15b2-cf2e-46b7-9a1f-40ac2834fda1: All allies in a 20-foot radius gain immunity to nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.
428f6aaa-70e3-47a2-b155-eb7255da79b6: All allies in a 20-foot radius gain immunity to nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases, poisons, {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and ability drain for 10 minutes.
3ab98bcc-c0bc-4c49-b87f-8e18d7a61201: All allies in a 30-foot radius gain the combined effect of Avenger's Blessing, Mind Blank and Holy Sword {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for one hour.
ec8d8277-5ef6-43de-bef6-593a9048c560: All allies in a 30-foot radius receive {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/-. Angel can activate his Sword of Heaven ability one more time per day.
8a7500c0-5695-4df5-bc98-62ae3a57aafa: All debts have been paid, all decisions have been made. Now the Commander has but one thing to do — follow the chosen path until the end.
dae46889-0d72-4c54-9b4a-7fddc3f492ce: All demons in a 40-foot radius around the caster make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g}. If it's failed, the demon is dealt 10 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the saving throw is successful, the demon is dealt {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage per caster level.
7cd55a5e-d6e3-41b5-9612-26fad5c27b53: Angel can now imbue weapons of others with the same holy power. Angel can still imbue weapons of only one creature.
782e310f-17f8-4a0a-b07a-a8aa36951d80:
Angel's Halo now emanates an aura similar to the effect of holy aura {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
A brilliant divine radiance surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by evil creatures, and causing evil creatures to become blinded when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Unlike protection from evil, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by evil creatures.
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 20 + Angel's mythic rank against evil spells and spells cast by evil creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from all mind-affecting spells and effects.
Finally, if an evil creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a creature warded by a holy aura, the offending attacker is blinded (Fortitude save negates, as blindness, but against holy aura's save ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal 10 + half your character level + your mythic rank + your highest ability modifier)).
47991899-644c-4cc1-b1a4-5bcbc109968f:
Angels can imbue their weapons with holy power. Weapons imbued with holy power deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, while {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities used while holding imbued weapons deal an additional 2 dice of damage or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} an additional 2 dice of damage.
You can use Sword of Heaven a number of times per day equal to 1 plus half your mythic rank.
24917482-b67c-4094-bedd-eb32e61a9e56: Another key to the portal has been found. That should be enough.
6a3326e1-1727-4ab1-a963-6fd0fdae3afa: Ask Katair about the mysterious grave
c9ceb485-9bfa-44f7-abe4-4cf80d924134: At 2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, and 10th mythic ranks, an Angel can select an improvement to the Sword of Heaven ability. Improvements that are available at 8th and 10th ranks are significantly more powerful.
ec92b1d0-9367-47e9-8b46-48fe980e3694:
At 3rd rank, Angel receives the ability to cast mythic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. He can either choose to take it as part of an existing full divine spellcaster spellbook, or as a standalone spellbook.
Standalone spellbook has an independent progression and spell slots. The number of its spell slots can't be increased with the Abundant Casting mythic feat.
In case of merging spellbooks the maximum caster level of the spells within it is 30, and you can use spell slots from the original spellbook to cast mythic spells. Raising the caster level makes spells more powerful. The number of spell slots can be increased with the Abundant Casting mythic feat. Spontaneous spellcasters get the new known spells from their original class and from mythic path independently: the original class's progression doesn't change, and every mythic rank increase gives additional known spells.
If you are multiclassing, it is recommended to use the standalone spellbook.
ec93f43f-6fdf-46f4-b952-8d68be2295b9: At 5th, 7th, and 9th mythic rank, an Angel can select an improvement to the Angelic Halo ability.
c447a1e2-3af4-4221-a938-5e494cac4164: Bring the legendary sword to Regnard
cf8d35fa-0492-4dd0-bb54-39bb94ae6469: By the Will of the Stars
15dc8e6f-980d-4ab1-913c-ef0f6d550188: Ceremonial weapons have fallen into the hands of undead created from the bodies of noble chiefs.
e7c8b69d-804d-4e3d-889b-b013cea3815b: Change alignment toward good and order
9afc1a21-178c-4e96-b6d0-ed8baae6b1a2: Creatures that live for hundreds, even thousands, of years have their own views on the time allowed for any given emotion. There are those among them who remember the pain or joy they have experienced for centuries. Sometimes entire generations of mortals, scarcely aware of what is happening to them, get dragged into the games of such creatures. This is what {name} faces — the Echo of Deskari, the demon lord's avatar, driven by an old grudge against a dead god, has chosen the leader of the crusaders as the object of his vengeance. He must be stopped, and then — eliminated.
84f35b29-9ec9-467e-8e20-9dc7ab2c9d7e: Cristry and Vestari claim they fell in love by the will of the stars. However, no matter how romantic it may sound, the couple have broken the laws of the shrine, laws which were created for a reason. Now their fate is in the hands of the Commander.
725d616c-70cd-488f-99c4-7b19b4b5cef7: Decide the lovers' fate together with Eliandra
79729ab1-72e7-49be-b7b3-2ed524c7190c: Defeat Deskari once and for all in his realm
84de3583-35fe-480d-a3c1-5a0676b3c45e: Devotion to duty, devotion to a cause, devotion to the pursuit of knowledge. How thin is the line between these and insanity? In the heart of the cursed lands, there is an enclave of stargazers and priests striving to solve the puzzles of the Worldwound. Isolated for a hundred years, keeping their very existence a secret, they have been trying to find a vulnerability in the scar connecting Golarion and the Abyss. Were they up to the task entrusted to them? The Commander will find out for {mf|himself|herself}.
a1fcca5b-554b-412a-a4ad-923fa2689539: Does absolute loyalty exist on the Material Plane? Loyalty to oneself, to others, to a group... Is this possible in closed communities such as the Shrine of Pulura? Did treachery truly find a home at Pulura's Fall? It would be interesting to find out the truth.
640dd667-596e-4cb9-881a-59888b316912: Eliandra has found the trail of the angel Targona at a location to the south of Pulura's Fall. The Commander should hurry there.
2bb31b84-02c0-4463-a6f8-1ea4b1fa37bb: Eliandra senses fear and anxiety in one of the shrine's guards. What is weighing on them?
2f002230-7442-40cc-bb8f-56042b1dcc7d: Every enemy in a 30-foot radius is dealt 12 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Half of this damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, half is holy damage. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} reduces the amount to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d12{/g} damage per caster level.
5679b356-45d3-4b54-a4c3-446900273839: Every enemy in the radius of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is dealt {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Allies are dealt 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g} per caster level, but are automatically {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} from any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} damage, blindness, confusion, and dazzled, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated and sickened conditions. Additionally, it tries to dispel all diseases, poisons and curses from the allies.
c6b18c25-0319-443f-b0a4-a7de367075bd: Everything comes to an end one way or another, even Deskari's rule. His horrible shadow has loomed over the world long enough — now it is time for it to fade.
ca7b8045-2ce4-4b93-9aaa-ca880c97eecb: Explore the lair of the Echo of Deskari
61bf213f-61d8-4f90-8678-4bb3ca0bb884: Find Katair's secret place near the Stone Tree
16105381-2180-494f-9b04-519e79bca3e6: Find Ranhild's trail at the shrine of Gorum near Wintersun village
39888846-bca4-47de-b880-c1afd632a518: For one minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, any time the target is {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g} by a demon, the demon is dealt {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus 1 damage per two caster levels. Additionally, the target gains deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} equal to 2 plus 1 per six caster levels.
ed0842c8-6325-443a-819c-935b3ac525ae: For one minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal addition {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per four caster levels, and any creature striking the target in melee deals normal damage, but also takes 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per caster level.
ead5ebc6-27b4-4995-951a-48ca4187a4b9: For the next number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, you become {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g} and gain the ability to shoot rays of holy fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level, half of which is fire and half is holy.
35b8f8c9-01fe-4b90-8a98-61f2b53e77ea: For the next one minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, if the target would be brought below zero {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, it is instead {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} to maximum and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per caster level to all enemies in a 20-foot radius.
7c7662ec-aa3e-4eb7-b482-44a0aaca4212: Go to the lair of the Echo of Deskari
0930ed0b-efc6-4ab5-b988-c03f7b5ddfc3: Go to the temple of Iomedae in Drezen
f44fd815-f2f1-4499-bb7e-47d65f2e4378: Go with the Hand of the Inheritor to Pulura's Fall
e0cd0352-cfd2-48c4-a915-382669c13931: In such a fragile system as the one that emerged in the Shrine of Pulura, any changes to the environment must be treated with utmost caution. Any interference could cause irrevocable consequences, and it is unknown what the Commander's decision will lead to.
e14aaff5-c5dd-471a-9292-4e7ac85b1903: Intercept the demon army near the Shrine of Pulura
13402bdb-9f4f-4bcf-b646-317980ed4c02: Iomedae herself revealed that her herald was not killed, but imprisoned by Baphomet. The golden-winged angel has played an important role in the Commander's fate. Meeting him face to face will be like looking in a mirror. What will the reflection show?
de05404c-d9c8-4c1d-8a12-e4ac0af07335: It is done. The Hunger of the Abyss and the self-proclaimed Usher of the Apocalypse has met his end.
ffb8a268-bf0a-4d24-b9aa-c4d64474c3bc: It turns out that Regnard's oddity is of a different nature than what he first claimed. It is amazing how important it is for people to have the chance to change, even if it never becomes anything more than a chance. It remains to be seen how Regnard's life will change after the Commander's intervention, but at least he was able to talk it out, sometimes that alone is a significant result.
ccc09817-3aa3-44be-b159-d527f35d83fd: It's time to return to Eliandra.
80151d16-9e2d-4e6b-a4aa-4409dd0c2bd4: Just as the tide sometimes reveals the remains of sea monsters, shipwrecks, and treasures on the seabed, the Commander, who has changed the course of the crusades, is bringing old names, faded hopes, and forgotten secrets back to life. Among them is the angel Targona, who was believed to have perished shortly before the fall of Drezen. There is a chance that she is not dead, but rather being held captive by the demons. The destination is known, all that remains is the journey. Now it's up to the Commander.
119dd976-2e3d-4c92-a299-fe945ac3f6a6: Katair has had his say. Now Regnard must accept his fate once and for all, whether it will make him happy or not.
fa7f66df-0490-4261-92d8-d59fb92c71e7: Meet the Hand of the Inheritor once again
e65ce98f-cae7-4794-8181-1b50718425e7: Mysterious and frightening, a space beyond the known planes lies before the Commander. The missing angel must be here somewhere. But where?
a991045c-fd32-4751-aa19-d6329a7e058d: Mythic Angel gains a celestial halo. Each ally within 50 feet of the Angel gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half Angel's mythic rank plus 1 to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures.
14101f23-d9e4-43f3-8a4f-cd9f03c78467: Now the shrine's guard will only know whatever truth the Commander chooses to tell.
ebddcd57-ac89-4c92-98fc-dbfbb66d50d3: One who assumes the burden of power often begins to horde that same power, thinking they deserve more of it than anyone else. Of course, a shrewd person would do so secretly, and only a fool would flaunt it. Is it possible that this is what the righteous rulers of the Shrine of Pulura have done?
ace6a95d-98e8-48f1-8e5a-ba0a2c6a2397: Overwhelmed by a sudden revelation, the Hand of the Inheritor has asked the Commander to talk to him in the Nexus.
c1baa4c5-e4f1-4f13-a269-8984659b4f73: Pay a surprise visit to the Echo of Deskari
a0d248ab-5fbc-46df-b65d-7dd9448994a7: Pulura's Fall is a curious testing ground in which to study the properties of memory and consciousness. As a means of coping with his isolation, the stargazer Odden celebrates his daughter's birthday each year. The daughter from his memory lives separately from the real one. That would seem to be enough. And still, he wants to know the truth.
9dd8e67d-6a24-463c-b924-44472f6c4fa8: Regnard's claims of being a good fighter mean little to Katair. But maybe he will listen to the commander of Drezen.
4fd5aedd-7ff5-40dc-8f60-b667eb28867d: Sword of Heaven now lasts for 1 minute per mythic rank.
0cf27c13-83ad-4d4c-9e80-a927d85b7bf8: Taeriell has observed Katair's movements in the stars and has begun to suspect that the shrine's defender was not as honest and noble as he seemed. Perhaps the Stone Tree holds the key to Katair's secret.
9e93e4cf-5ea3-42f1-a96b-9785b11e2911: Taeriell must hear Katair's story. It may lead to the reconciliation of two friends after seventy long years.
d930c9b0-b4b3-4f24-ba12-b0ed9e1b0c0b: Targona and the others are waiting in the Nexus to discuss the situation.
4e4b9783-b4b9-4bd6-95a1-533737ea3d5c: Targona believes that she will be able to find the entrance to the lair of the Echo of Deskari. The Commander must meet her in Alushinyrra near the portal to the Nexus.
e8692936-718f-4960-a005-dca12c522282: Targona is in trouble. However, the proud angel chose this fate willingly — she allowed herself to be captured to give the Commander a chance to track down the cunning demon who has escaped punishment for so long. It is time to put an end to this story.
f121c97c-b61a-47cb-ab6c-65c14d0831f0: Tell the guard about what transpired
2ada7040-3037-4a03-b915-9b195b4faec3: The Commander has achieved the impossible — {mf|he|she} infiltrated the lair of Deskari's avatar and emerged the victor.
4b8d3bed-9b1e-4569-b280-34d13c5bddb4: The Commander's intervention has affected Odden's memory and thought processes, reminding the stargazer of reality and creating a ripple that has disturbed his previously tranquil consciousness. However, more observations are required to comprehend what the Commander's choice has led to.
71db2d6f-5e89-4f84-a5d3-9f006c6a39fd: The Echo of Deskari is hiding somewhere nearby, and he has captured someone from Pulura's Fall. But how can the Commander find his hiding place and get inside without alerting the enemy?
2a028d5b-1c75-4cdb-bbc2-d76fbe4aa05e: The Hand of the Inheritor has stated the criteria for becoming a true angel. A little more good, a little more order. When that goal is reached, it would be worthwhile to inform the goddess's herald.
4d7915d9-8b1c-41f0-a686-37eb2f9854b5: The Holy Wardens are together again, and they stand ready to help the Commander fight a demon lord of the Abyss, and not for the first time. Is there a target more worthy of being cut down by heavenly blades than Iomedae's old foe, the lord of the Abyss and self-proclaimed Usher of the Apocalypse?
5c2b7235-1ad2-42cd-bd53-9652aa7f4eb8: The Holy Wardens will let the Commander know when they are ready to go to the Abyss. They want to go to the Rasping Rifts — Deskari's realm — and confront him there in his territory.
9352fa75-3fbd-47dd-9767-e699aaba5698: The Lady in Shadow has opened the way for the Commander to the lair of {mf|his|her} worst enemy. But it is unlikely that such a bold move did not attract attention. The Echo will be ready for the attack, but there is no other way.
57e75501-6500-4870-93fb-a78fc3c69b18: The Light of Heaven burns in the Commander's hands, but is {mf|his|her} soul Heaven-bound? Achieving harmony between strength and personality is not so easy — it requires self-improvement.
5cc1ca6e-86e1-4b53-b7e7-696719d6eb0c: The Road to Good and Justice
9d6d8e0d-8cad-4c31-af7a-e45fe56e291e: The Wardens have set a trap for Mutasafen. But to make him fall for it, the Commander must kill or scare off the demon in the Shrine of Pulura.
161f17b7-81a0-4758-9c07-83e922bd5f4c: The angel is occupied with her search and must be protected from the denizens of the Abyss!
347e3311-df42-489e-acac-24f65589135b: The community of Pulura's Fall took a step toward the Abyss. But it did not forsake its mission.
44dd8e5e-f32c-46a8-ad22-e3b91c171cdd: The cultist's story revealed that he used to serve the Echo of Deskari himself — the demon lord's monstrous avatar. And now this creature is aware that his old enemy, the herald of Iomedae, has arrived in the Worldwound.
d332552a-49a4-45e1-b474-093ec6b6896f: The darkness of the mysterious laboratory has been left behind. The Commander's gift was a saved angel — and even more unanswered questions.
ebcc9b73-c262-486c-aced-26aeeaf28b52: The dead man has been defeated. The Commander should return to Regnard and talk to him.
d8afd57f-b07d-4c38-85bc-8a85386432b3: The difficult work of self-improvement is complete — to the glory of the Commander and the joy of {mf|his|her} Heavenly ally.
90524f68-3b10-4c12-9b58-d349f403691b: The eyes of the stargazer Taeriell are trained on the stars, but Taeriell cannot find peace. What are the stars telling him?
fe5de71a-0bdd-450e-b9f6-74f98f55ea9d: The herald of the radiant goddess can transport the Commander to the secret shrine. He is but waiting for the Commander's signal.
aa06c560-860f-443b-aef2-d7969181efc7: The imprisoned cultist is casting an unknown spell at the shrine's exit. Something must be done, and quickly!
859951cf-5381-4e7d-964f-8679e100d095: The inscription on the tombstone says, "Katair, a warrior of Pulura, lies here." The only man fitting this description is alive and well. And able to explain the meaning of this grave.
30384f36-abc4-49f9-b742-6ef8e4031c78: The key to the barrier has been found. It is possible to set the captured angel free.
5295dc14-72d1-426c-9b0d-dd9fcfb73423: The leader of the newcomers turned out to be one of the traitors responsible for the death of the angel Lariel over seventy years ago. What can he tell us?
50a9bec6-76f3-4869-a20c-501a4bdbd545: The location of the portal has been established. But how does one open it?
26bd1529-2573-4d64-a26b-482cba9fdfad: The lost angel Targona has been found, but the barrier surrounding her could not be broken. Will anything in the laboratory help?
78350527-2465-421f-910b-0198e4333c4b: The mysterious place turned out to be a trap. It is protected by powerful magic and Abyssal emanations that allow one to enter but not exit. There is no door to break down, no lock to pick. The Commander must explore the trap and find a way out.
f0b43123-5a3d-4fbc-a9a2-953c5bc17e0d: The note found at the shrine of Gorum says that Ranhild and her mother set off for the Shrine of Pulura. There may be evidence of that in the vicinity of the shrine.
6958552d-39db-4d1e-8bb5-466f46f6654e:
The owner of the imbued weapon now is under effect similar to Haste, but granting 2 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and making all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of level 7 or lower quickened, as though using the Quicken Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Quicken Spell: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round or 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} cannot be quickened.
31e03466-69cc-4126-995c-07b5d420e9a2: The portal to the lair of the Echo of Deskari is located in the slums in Alushinyrra's Lower City.
1567d74b-6169-49a5-b5b9-0c86adcc185b: The priestess Eliandra has asked the Commander to talk to the members of the stargazer community. The Hand of the Inheritor also senses that the people's strength and confidence have been undermined. Will the Commander be able to return resilience and hope to these people? Will {mf|he|she} even want to? After all, a request from a priestess is only a request.
54162385-3a8c-45e4-8ef1-d7b2ea4371f8: The proud and overconfident queen has gone missing somewhere in the depths of the Worldwound. Will she reject the Commander as her heavenly patroness did?
4e1087da-f92e-4654-bbf8-b31a495727a1: The saved angel is waiting to speak to the Commander. And she has something to reveal.
0aa1dff2-6b32-4887-829b-711b7270e617: The secret shrine is under threat — the demon called Mutasafen is leading an army there. The Commander's allies have rushed off in pursuit. What will they say once they learn Iomedae's verdict? Will the shrine stand or fall? How can one stop a demon who so deftly evades death?
b4614aec-2c00-455f-956a-52b89a3ca028: The shrine's guard has indicated the rune-marked boulder where a mysterious note was found, possibly intended for enemies. Eager to find out who is engaging in treasonous communication, the guard's interest can be satisfied only by setting up an ambush.
e790a6e0-f179-4db8-bb3d-dee741b1ef6c: The stargazer Odden said that his family was hiding at the shrine of Gorum near Wintersun village and has asked the Commander to give a present to his daughter, Ranhild. A sentimental gesture, but perhaps all traces of Ranhild are not yet lost to the mists of time.
531258f6-42f5-480e-a509-50557f88d8fe: The stargazer Regnard, who studies and preserves the history of Sarkoris in his free time, has asked the Commander to bring him the sword of Ailberije, a mythical Sarkorian ruler said to have built Iz. He claims that the corpse of Ailberije is still lying outside the shrine.
a54e0dc8-1cc8-4492-8792-ec23e1564d1f: The stargazer Vestari, caught red-handed, has revealed the name "Cristry" and claims that Cristry can shed some light on his strange behavior.
d5fb8e7a-5d6a-47bd-ad33-c460bf95c25f: The target gains immunity to diseases for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
26b10a1b-fc50-43ff-b00a-f95a108c8ac3: The target gains immunity to fatigue, exhaustion, nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases, poisons, {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and ability drain for 10 minutes.
cded7d55-9228-4a26-8a2a-6b420baf8236: The target gains immunity to nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases and poisons for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
d4de13c2-68c0-4a11-b1de-cce0bcd1ce72: The target gains immunity to nauseated and sickened conditions, diseases, poisons, {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and ability drain for 10 minutes.
0b991748-16e9-42dd-8593-a88072af1898: The target suffers a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
7f4318c4-90c1-43f9-8cb5-9086ad983d6f: The target suffers a -4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
5ba63feb-296d-4ac6-b3f3-37eec78c301e:
The transmuted creatures move and act more quickly than normal.[LONGSTART] This extra {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} has several effects.[LONGEND]
When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, a hasted creature may make one extra attack with its main weapon.[LONGSTART] The attack is made using the creature's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This effect is not cumulative with similar effects, such as that provided by a speed weapon, nor does it actually grant an extra {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, so you can't use it to cast a second {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or otherwise take an extra action in the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.)[LONGEND]
A hasted creature gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Any condition that makes you lose your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.[LONGEND]
A hasted creature's speed increases by 30 feet, to a maximum of twice the subject's normal speed.[LONGSTART] This increase counts as an enhancement bonus. Multiple haste effects don't stack. Haste dispels slow.[LONGEND]
893a9025-7de2-4c7d-845a-6b7b87abfa03: The truth about Ranhild is in the Commander's hands. Whether or not Odden learns of the tragic events, he is still expecting some sort of answer.
e7766758-fc8d-496a-bdb0-0a26b193c364: There are victims to be rescued, enemies to be defeated, and secrets to be revealed. Only then can the Commander start on the journey back. The Hand of the Inheritor will help in this.
29c96404-eb0c-460d-ba92-43a2a0a13f10: There is sorrow in the heart of the stargazer Odden, despite his cheerful demeanor. What could be the cause?
0b4e815d-eed9-421f-9be6-db478e582817: This ability summons a Movanic Deva for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
b525c859-374a-4add-ba40-2a43a1c3b112: This ability summons a Spirit Guardian for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
b42121dc-bca4-42de-b030-83d71d7319cb: This ability summons a Spirit Paladin for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
9b3649ed-5f5a-4a1c-a460-06070bbee3d9: This ability summons a pair of Astral Devas for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
6dd33ede-d6ae-4f2d-9c14-9eb8a8c4b18f: This ability summons a pair of Movanic Devas for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
3145c796-bd06-4df8-9e65-1d9c140a536e: This ability summons a pair of Spirit Paladins for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
7b218a3e-4457-446a-b414-4c2f1124201b: This ability summons an Astral Deva for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
7a455bb8-1d59-45c1-8b64-78e692522892: This ability summons four Astral Devas for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
ee55c39b-0262-4ad6-9d00-a99e9f088166: This ability summons three Spirit Guardians for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
13b92c1e-d94f-40e0-b982-7706e618b267: This blessing targets one ally in close range. The ally is granted the combined effect of Shield, Shield of Faith, Protection From Arrows, Displacement and Resist Fire, Cold, Electricity, Acid and Sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for one minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
6a7415d6-e9c8-40c2-bb47-7a2b64ec9fdb: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targets{/g} an ally in close range. The target gains the combined effect of Divine Power, Holy Aura and Greater Heroism {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
f761c2c4-b17e-46c2-b347-c20eb1d97170: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} affects all undead creatures, evil outsiders and divine casters devoted to evil deities. If the target fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g}, it's frightened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the saving throw is successful, the target is shaken for one round. This spell ignores immunity to fear effects.
8676adc0-9165-4434-a6a1-83cdb2d7fbcb: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like bolt of justice, except it affects multiple creatures.
8bb5fe41-7f10-4217-adb4-defd8d9cd637:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} restores 10 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}HP{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
Unlike other spells that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, bring back can bring recently slain creatures back to life. If cast upon a creature that has died within 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, apply the healing from this spell to the creature. If the healed creature's hit point total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If the creature's hit point total is at a negative amount equal to or greater than its Constitution score, the creature remains dead. Creatures brought back to life with this spell gain a temporary negative level that lasts for 1 day.
3739a25a-d2b6-48ce-a3e5-3f18205853c2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} works as Aegis of the Faithful, but affects all allies in a 20-foot radius and lasts for 1 hour.
88721633-0742-44cb-9f84-626030fd4e30: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} works as Breath of Life, but affects all allies in a 20-foot radius.
1511df2e-6322-4255-9cda-b7b4d7fb28be: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} works as True Resurrection, but affects every ally in a 30-foot radius around the caster.
a13bad1d-ba1a-4e5a-8ff9-0b2ad51b0fe8: Those driven by duty can be merciless not only toward themselves but toward others as well. Katair, who has guarded the shrine loyally from enemies and friends alike, doomed himself to solitude. However, those who are incapable of understanding any rationale other than self-interest cannot hope to understand his actions.
4a3b3d2f-90c2-4131-b60a-9da72fab548b: Vestari and Cristry must be informed of Eliandra's decision
80283164-e7b6-46a1-9a36-12209029ec37: Visit Mutasafen in his secret hideout
8a4de45c-d4f4-44a6-8055-6005d0695778: Warn the Hand of the Inheritor
e605e394-e42a-4e31-8888-a3d2f259ebec: Was that a series of trials, or merely a voluntarily chosen path? But who could argue that the Commander, though not a properly ascended angel, has done more than most of Heaven's warriors?
589f1ccb-58ba-44bb-b8a8-a7f845aad3c6: Weapons of an angel become the bane to all demons. You gain +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against creatures with Demon subtype, and successful hits deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}. This bonus stacks with Bane special quality.
2e5bd69e-9af6-48e7-81dd-fcba1f22eb36: Weapons of the angel become a bane to all diseases. A creature wielding them becomes immune to diseases. {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by that creature now remove all diseases from the target and also remove fatigued, exhausted, sickened, and nauseated conditions. Creatures that apply diseases on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} or are otherwise closely linked to diseases suffer an additional 50% of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the wielder as {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}.
6eb4bcfd-ab1f-4db8-a6d3-b2777a37a805: Weapons of the angel become a bane to all guile. A creature wielding them becomes immune to compulsion effects. {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by that creature now remove all mind-affecting effects from the target. Creatures that commonly use compulsion suffer an additional 50% of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the wielder as {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}.
32ec6dde-fb19-4547-89de-f1e0d9ea6282: Weapons of the angel become a bane to all poisons. A creature wielding them becomes immune to poisons. {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by that creature now remove all poisons from the target and heal all {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and ability drain. Creatures that apply poison on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} or are otherwise closely linked to poisons suffer an additional 50% of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the wielder as {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}.
4b92f552-0dfa-49b1-a236-ed9d4540c2ed: Weapons of the angel become a bane to all undeath. A creature wielding them becomes immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effects and energy drain. {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by that creature now remove paralysis and all negative levels from the target. Undead creatures suffer an additional 50% of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the wielder as {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}.
73c69975-0322-4338-be40-fe00bc033de1: What a deviously ironic twist of fate — the one who has the Light of Heaven inside {mf|him|her} has been rejected by the goddess whose chosen one {mf|he|she} was considered to be. The very thought of an angel created in a laboratory is the worst kind of blasphemy, after all, to say nothing of one made with the blood of fallen demon lords. So what will the self-proclaimed angel do, now that {mf|he|she} has refused to renounce that which the goddess expressly denied {mf|him|her}?
7cb73828-fcd4-4b2d-a156-ef62ac677064: When a demon lord is slain, they are reborn within their own realm. But if they are slain once more after that, they perish for good. Deskari, your time has come!
5e7b9ff9-28da-43f9-ad59-b8f2d4d88483: Whenever Angelic Halo is active, all allies in the 50-foot area get a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to fire, cold, acid and electricity resistances equal to 5 per Angel's mythic rank, and a bonus to sonic and negative {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} equal to 3 per Angel's mythic rank, as well as a bonus to force, unholy, holy and divine resistance equal to Angel's mythic rank.
3c60f3eb-475f-4f85-b290-4095d6e54e70: Whenever Angelic Halo is active, all demons and undead creatures in the 50-foot area suffer ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + mythic rank) points of holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
886fda7b-4998-4f8f-be25-5c954e3acc9b: Whenever Angelic Halo is active, all enemies in a 50-foot area suffer a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 1 + half the Angel's mythic rank, as well as a penalty to all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to the half the penalty to spell resistance.
c1295e7c-1348-4582-88d5-284e28ae1a72: Whenever Angelic Halo is active, an enemy that {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} the Angel first time in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your character level + your mythic rank + your highest ability modifier) or be blinded for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 round. On a successful saving throw, the enemy becomes dazzled for 1 minute.
13b2678e-cc40-4306-b7a7-a3cce952669f: Whenever Angelic Halo is active, the Angel doesn't suffer any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the allies' {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that have an area of effect. If Angel is the main target of such a spell, it becomes empowered, as though using the Empower Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, and the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against it is increased by 2.
15c3600d-4258-4bde-b93d-cd7cf06ffeca: Whenever Sword of Heaven is active, this ability allows the Angel to transform all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by the Angel into {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g}.
541bf09a-cb51-4350-a4c3-6ff4a707a4c7: Whenever the angel activates the Sword of Heaven ability, it restores him 10 HP, heals all ability damage and removes the following negative conditions: blind, confused, dazed, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, sickened, stunned. It also dispels the effects of the feeblemind spell and ecorche's Seize Skin ability.
b164b811-2e7c-41c7-bcd9-302defcde6e4: While Angelic Halo is active, whenever an ally suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, they receive fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} equal to Angel's mythic rank for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
5e0b08aa-9b45-43ce-a2d8-e76187d49f19: While Eliandra and Katair are arguing about what to do with the prisoners, the Commander should talk to this person.
fd343e99-0f61-42d9-a142-199d1383626c: You bring special favor upon yourself and your allies while bringing disfavor to your enemies. You and each of your allies gain a +2 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, while each of your foes takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on such {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
1edc58b8-63fe-4303-b777-8dbe84163476: You can grant the benefits of your Sword of Heaven ability to all allies in a 50-foot radius.
5ffcc41e-1282-468b-8e98-25d39fe648fa: You create a 20-foot radius area for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Each round every creature in the area is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per two caster levels.
9c281cd1-9a22-40c0-9751-553bc74f670f: You create a 60-foot long line of holy energy, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} to all targets on the line.
024a8a45-4d33-45a3-a60e-cbb956ecd4c8: You create a wall of light, which deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to any evil creature going through it. It grants any good or neutral creature an ability to deal 2d6 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}holy damage{/g} with their next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If a good or neutral creature charges through the wall, it instead deals 1d6 holy damage per caster level with their next attack.
581396aa-63f4-4942-8ed1-1db605bac63c: You gain a +2 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
73e55c83-dc07-437c-8c80-02547c065ab1: You gain a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
dfe4738b-9048-4c25-be68-d25db3f3e25f: You make a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any undead creature. If it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g}, it is immediately destroyed. If the target succeeds, it is dealt {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus 1 damage per 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}.
8ee20403-2d44-4aeb-ae48-dadd53ef6774:
You release a powerful stroke of energy that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of holy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The target needs to make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g}, or become prone.
If the target is evil, the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} instead deals 1d8 points of holy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}damage{/g} per caster level. The target needs to make a successful Reflex saving throw, or become prone and suffer a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and saving throws.
If the target is an evil outsider or an undead creature, the spell instead deals 1d10 points of holy damage per caster level. The target needs to make a successful Reflex saving throw, or become prone and suffer a -4 penalty to AC, attack rolls and saving throws.
If the target is a demon lord, an evil dragon or a lord of undead (a powerful undead creature like liches, undead dragons, nightshades and similar), the spell instead deals 1d12 points of holy damage per caster level. The target suffers a -4 penalty to AC, attack rolls and saving throws. It also needs to make a successful Reflex saving throw, or become prone.
9d2a7a29-911e-4bdd-80ba-ddf4f7682f57: You shoot a ray of holy fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, half of which is fire and half is holy.
11b4ee7d-ad55-4665-9c6a-e6b62fa070c2: You {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} yourself for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} and automatically dispel any negative effects on yourself.
2836fc61-9630-41a8-ba80-6b60bd918e8c: Young Regnard is one of the best stargazers in the shrine, but even this does not make him happy. Why?
4bc34e3b-6ca1-4fdd-8dcd-15429d0b40a8: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} of the owner of the imbued weapon now additionally deal weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all enemies within 5 feet.
3b22975a-d4ba-45eb-b10e-77d5ef73a779: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} with the imbued weapon now mark the target for 1 minute, making the target visible, giving the target a -40 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}stealth checks{/g} and a -4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
